1.7 Project Scale and Estimated GHG Emission Reductions or Removals
As per section 3.9.1 of VCS standard Version 3.6, the projects are classified as follows:
1) Projects: Less than or equal to 300,000 tonnes of CO2e per year
2) Large projects: Greater than 300,000 tonnes of CO2e per year
Each project activity instances being included under grouped project activity currently have less
than 300,000 tCO2e per year emission reductions, hence these project activity instances are
classified as “Projects”. However in case of any project activity instance, if GHG emission
reductions or removals are greater than 300,000 tonnes of CO2e per year, then project activity
instances are considered as Large projects.
Similarly, the estimated GHG Emission Reductions will depend upon the power generation
capacity of individual project activity instances. The emission reductions achieved as part of
grouped project activity will increase as per addition of new project activity instances in the future.
However, estimated Emission Reduction for the initial project activity instances being included in
the grouped project activity are as follows:

v3.1 15

JOINT PROJECT DESCRIPTION & MONITORING REPORT: VCS Version 3
The above annual estimation for all initial project activity instances is based on estimated PLF
and total capacity of all project activity instances, ir-respective of commissioning date of project
activity instances, thus in actual emission reductions vary based on actual PLF and
commissioning date of project activity instance.

1.7 Project Scale and Estimated GHG Emission Reductions or Removals
The project is a large scale project that involves setting up of 140.0 MW of Solar power project.
As the estimated annual average GHG emission reductions or removal per year is 241,573 tCO e 2
which is less than 300,000 tonnes of CO e per year, thus the project falls in the category of 2
Project.
3 The ER estimation is done based on 20.50% PLF and 8760 hours of annual operation and 0.5% of
degradation factor per year from second year. This is as per DPR assumption. However for IRR sheet
electricity generation is determined based on financial year and number of days of financial year and
expected date of commissioning considered for IRR calculations.

1.7 Project Scale and Estimated GHG Emission Reductions or Removals
The project activity is a run-­of-­river type hydropower plant. The power density of daily regulating
storage is 184.211 W/m2. Total installed capacity of the project is 210 MW, consisting of three (3)
x 70 MW turbines. The 3 x 70 MW installed capacity generates an average of 953,128 emission
reduction credits per year.
Emission reduction estimates over a crediting period of 10 (ten) years from 1 August 2016 until 31
July 2026 is provided in the table below:
v3.3 5
